metadata.feature_description: Integrate Disqus commenting system for post discussions

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display Disqus comments on post detail page

steps.action: Navigate to Publisher post detail page (News > Test Workflow Post - Submit for Review)
steps.expected: Post detail page loads with Disqus comments section visible below the post content
steps.actual: Post detail page loads but NO Disqus comments section is displayed. Page shows post title, date, content, author info, and share buttons only. No disqus_thread div or comments area visible.

steps.action: Check Disqus Connector configuration in Settings > Connectors
steps.expected: Disqus Connector should be configured with valid shortname and API key
steps.actual: Disqus Connector is NOT configured. Status shows 'Connect' button instead of 'Edit' or 'View'. Configuration form shows empty 'Disqus shortname' and 'API Key' fields.

steps.action: Open Disqus configuration form to verify settings
steps.expected: Configuration form should show existing Disqus credentials
steps.actual: Configuration form displays with empty text fields for 'Disqus shortname' and 'API Key'. No credentials are configured.

issues: Disqus Connector is not configured - both shortname and API Key fields are empty
Without Disqus configuration, the comments section does not appear on post detail pages
The ShowComments property in Detail.ascx depends on HasBeenConfigured from DisqusManager, which returns false when no shortname is set

observations: Code analysis confirms the Disqus integration exists in Components/Integration/DisqusManager.cs and Views/Detail.ascx (lines 76-106)
The comments section rendering is conditional on ShowComments property which checks if Disqus HasBeenConfigured
The Disqus Connector UI is accessible via Settings > Connectors and shows the configuration form correctly
Feature requires external Disqus account and API credentials to function - these are not configured in the test environment
